title: Which of the following statements best describes the shuffle() function? This function accepts an array as its first argument.

choices.a: A new array is returned with elements in a random order. Each value retains its original key.
choices.b: The original array is modified so elements are now in a random order. Each value retains its original key.
choices.c: The original array is modified so elements are now in a random order. New keys are assigned to elements.
choices.d: A new array is returned with elements in a random order. New keys are assigned to elements.

answers: The original array is modified so elements are now in a random order. New keys are assigned to elements.
